sentences.sContent: The bishop helped foster the sense of a community embracing all classes.
sentences.sCn: 主教鼓励一种包容各个阶层的社区精神。

sentences.sContent: Little Jack was placed with foster parents.
sentences.sCn: 小杰克被安置在养父母家。

synos.tran: 培养；养育，抚育；抱（希望等）

phrases.pCn: 寄养家庭；抚养孤儿的家庭
n. 朱迪·福斯特（美国女演员）

remMethod.val: fost(看作fast， 快速的)+er→受到鼓舞， 快速前进→鼓励

trans.tranCn: 培养；养育，抚育；抱（希望等）
trans.tranOther: to help a skill, feeling, idea etc develop over a period of time
Foster parents are people who officially take a child into their family for a period of time, without becoming the child's legal parents. The child is referred to as their foster child.

trans.tranCn: (Foster)人名；(英、捷、意、葡、法、德、俄、西)福斯特
